title: How to copy all bold paragraph in word to another document - Quora

response.answer_text: Ctrl-F opens the Navigation pane. Click the down arrow at the top (next to the magnifying glass), and select Advanced Find from the drop-down list. At the bottom of the Find and Replace window which appears, click Format. In the pop-up list that appears, select Font. Open the Font Style list, and select Bold. Click OK. The Find and Replace window reappears. Click Find Next until the cursor jumps to bold text. If the whole paragraph is bold, the whole paragraph will be automatically selected. Copy (using right click) and paste the paragraph to another document. Return to the original document. Repeat Find Next , copy and paste.

The same way you'd cut and paste anything else. If you're pasting it into the middle of copy that's not formatted the way you want it to be, use Paste Special / Keep formatting (In most instances, you can't use the keyboard shortcut for this one.)
